ISSUE.TITLE: bug: yaml file array format problem
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue description ```yaml routes: - uri: "/*" vars: - - "scheme" - "==" - "http" ``` this configure can work normally, but yaml will give an error if you write like this ```yaml routes: - uri: "/*" vars: - - "scheme" - "==" - "http" ``` ### Environment * apisix version (cmd: `apisix version`): * OS: ### Minimal test code / Steps to reproduce the issue 1. 2. 3. ### What's the actual result? (including assertion message & call stack if applicable) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26682689/78108232-8d389c00-7429-11ea-882d-2d7c904b1029.png) ### What's the expected result? As long as the yaml array is legal, it should be supported

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: perf: no longer generate unnecessary nginx conf for better performance. (#1968) * perf: no longer generate unnecessary nginx conf for better performance. * benchmark: sync nginx.conf for fake-apisix. > Is this PR backward compatible? Disable two plugins by default(proxy-cache, proxy-mirror), if the user wants to enable them, need to modify the conf/config.yaml by manual.
